availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Anderson Pigg. Married to Elizabeth Guy Pigg. Father of Adaline Pigg, William L. Pigg, Mary L. Pigg, Thomas M. Pigg, Jennett Pigg, John Pigg, Caroline Pigg, Martha Pigg, and Sally B. Pigg. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860. Farmer in Powell County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District No. 2, p. 62B-63A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 8.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Callawaay County, Liberty Township, p. 383B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Powell County, KY, October 1863, p. 122.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Powell County Births.
"Woodford William Pigg (1820-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial 102493741, Accessed August 9, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102493741.
